name: Have Another Drink On Me Quiz | Wines, Beers and Spirits | 10 Questions

questions.text: In March 1993, Miller became the first major American brewing company in several decades to introduce and nationally market a full flavored top fermented beer. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
Miller Reserve Amber Ale.

	The new beer was brewed with 100 per cent barley malt and true ale yeast.

questions.text: What was the name of the founder of the Coors Brewing Company?
questions.explanation:
Adolph Coors.

	The Coors company of Golden, Colorado operated for 114 years at the same site, high in the Rocky Mountains that was selected by Adolph Coors himself in 1873.

questions.text: Where is the oldest brewery on the American continent?
questions.explanation:
Montreal.

	Molson Breweries was started by John Molson in 1786. The beer drinkers of the city, having been used to paying more for beer than for rum, due to the fact that Quebec was a wine drinking region, welcomed the new brewery with open arms.

questions.text: Tiger Lager is from which South East Asia country?
questions.explanation:
Singapore.

	Produced by Asia Pacific Breweries, this is one of the most popular beers in the region.

questions.text: According to Paul Hogan's long running commercials, what is 'Australian for beer'?
questions.explanation:
Fosters.

	Fosters, which has also been dubbed 'Australia's national beverage', was ironically named after a pair of American brothers, who spent less than 18 months in Australia. They founded their Fosters Brewing Company in Melbourne, in 1887. They sold it the following year and went back home, never to be heard of again.

questions.text: Introduced in 1991, New Zealand's Steinlager Blue was marketed with an advertising campaign featuring characters from an American movie. What were they?
questions.explanation:
'The Blues Brothers'.

	Steinlager is brewed in Auckland by Lion Breweries which is owned by Australia's Lion Nathan Group.

questions.text: What famous secular Belgian Ale is produced by the Moortgat family at Breendonk?
questions.explanation:
Duvel.

	The brewery at Breendonk was founded in 1871 by Jan Leonart Moorthat. It now produces a variety of other products including, Steendonk, and some Pilsen style beers such as Bel, Godefroy, Silver and Wander.

questions.text: Italy's Birra Peroni Industriale was founded in Vigevano in 1846 by Francesco Peroni. It was relocated in 1867 by Giovanni Peroni, To where?
questions.explanation:
Rome.

	The Brewing of Peroni now takes place throughout Italy, principally in Rome, Bari and Padova.

questions.text: Kronenbourg is which country's biggest brand of beer?
questions.explanation:
France.

	Founded in Strasbourg, Alsace, in June 1664, Kronenbourg brews more beer than any brewing company in Germany.

questions.text: What is the name of the area of London, located on the south bank of the Thames, that has been renowned for brewing for centuries?
questions.explanation:
Southwark.

	Noted in Chaucer's Canterbury Tales, Shakespeare's Falstaff was based on one of Southwark's leading brewing figures. Pepys viewed the Great Fire of London (1666) from a Southwark ale house, and Dr. Samuel Johnson earned a few quid as an investor in the Thrale family brewery.
